Leonard H. Marks
NOTES:
Although red tape has presented our making a public announcement, NAEB signed a
USOE contract in mid-December for $56,000 to conduct the space spectrum survey
of ETV.
The Sudan contract, submitted almost four months ago, is to be signed this week.
Overhead in combined contracts will bring us somewhat more than $35,000,
Prospects are very good for a radio production contract that should yield $15,000.
Magnuson bill hearing set for March 1 - 2.
The newly appointed Assistant Secretary for HEW is Ivan Nestingen, currently
mayor of Madison, Wis,, and friend of M, S. Novick and yours truly.
New Commissioner of Education, Sterling M. McMurrin, Vice President of U. of
Utah, has been strong champion of Engar's ETV set-up.
